values.name: cronExpression
values.description:
Use custom cron expression. Values and ranges as follows:
  • Seconds: 0-59
  • Minutes: 0 - 59
  • Hours: 0 - 23
  • Day of Month: 1 - 31
  • Months: 0 - 11 (Jan - Dec)
  • Day of Week: 0 - 6 (Sun - Sat)

properties.displayName: This node must be connected to an AI chain. Insert one
properties.name: notice
model
properties.description: The model which will generate the completion. To download models, visit Ollama Models Library.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls the randomness of the generated text. Lower values make the output more focused and deterministic, while higher values make it more diverse and random.

options.name: topK
options.description: Limits the number of highest probability vocabulary tokens to consider at each step. A higher value increases diversity but may reduce coherence. Set to -1 to disable.

options.name: topP
options.description: Chooses from the smallest possible set of tokens whose cumulative probability exceeds the probability top_p. Helps generate more human-like text by reducing repetitions.

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Adjusts the penalty for tokens that have already appeared in the generated text. Higher values discourage repetition.

options.name: keepAlive
options.description: Specifies the duration to keep the loaded model in memory after use. Useful for frequently used models. Format: 1h30m (1 hour 30 minutes).

options.name: lowVram
options.description: Whether to Activate low VRAM mode, which reduces memory usage at the cost of slower generation speed. Useful for GPUs with limited memory.

options.name: mainGpu
options.description: Specifies the ID of the GPU to use for the main computation. Only change this if you have multiple GPUs.

options.name: numBatch
options.description: Sets the batch size for prompt processing. Larger batch sizes may improve generation speed but increase memory usage.

options.name: numCtx
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to use as context for generating the next token. Smaller values reduce memory usage, while larger values provide more context to the model.

options.name: numGpu
options.description: Specifies the number of GPUs to use for parallel processing. Set to -1 for auto-detection.

options.name: numPredict
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to -1 for no limit. Be cautious when setting this to a large value, as it can lead to very long outputs.

options.name: numThread
options.description: Specifies the number of CPU threads to use for processing. Set to 0 for auto-detection.

options.name: penalizeNewline
options.description: Whether the model will be less likely to generate newline characters, encouraging longer continuous sequences of text

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Adjusts the penalty for tokens based on their presence in the generated text so far. Positive values penalize tokens that have already appeared, encouraging diversity.

options.name: repeatPenalty
options.description: Adjusts the penalty factor for repeated tokens. Higher values more strongly discourage repetition. Set to 1.0 to disable repetition penalty.

options.name: useMLock
options.description: Whether to lock the model in memory to prevent swapping. This can improve performance but requires sufficient available memory.

options.name: useMMap
options.description: Whether to use memory mapping for loading the model. This can reduce memory usage but may impact performance. Recommended to keep enabled.

options.name: vocabOnly
options.description: Whether to only load the model vocabulary without the weights. Useful for quickly testing tokenization.

options.name: format
options.description: Specifies the format of the API response

options.name: mainGpu
options.description: Specifies the ID of the GPU to use for the main computation. Only change this if you have multiple GPUs.

options.name: numBatch
options.description: Sets the batch size for prompt processing. Larger batch sizes may improve generation speed but increase memory usage.

options.name: numCtx
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to use as context for generating the next token. Smaller values reduce memory usage, while larger values provide more context to the model.

options.name: numGpu
options.description: Specifies the number of GPUs to use for parallel processing. Set to -1 for auto-detection.

options.name: numPredict
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to -1 for no limit. Be cautious when setting this to a large value, as it can lead to very long outputs.

options.name: numThread
options.description: Specifies the number of CPU threads to use for processing. Set to 0 for auto-detection.

options.name: penalizeNewline
options.description: Whether the model will be less likely to generate newline characters, encouraging longer continuous sequences of text

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Adjusts the penalty for tokens based on their presence in the generated text so far. Positive values penalize tokens that have already appeared, encouraging diversity.

options.name: repeatPenalty
options.description: Adjusts the penalty factor for repeated tokens. Higher values more strongly discourage repetition. Set to 1.0 to disable repetition penalty.

options.name: useMLock
options.description: Whether to lock the model in memory to prevent swapping. This can improve performance but requires sufficient available memory.

options.name: useMMap
options.description: Whether to use memory mapping for loading the model. This can reduce memory usage but may impact performance. Recommended to keep enabled.

options.name: vocabOnly
options.description: Whether to only load the model vocabulary without the weights. Useful for quickly testing tokenization.

options.name: format
options.description: Specifies the format of the API response

properties.name: noticeTools

options.name: frequency_penalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768).

options.name: n
options.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt. Note: Because this parameter generates many completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use carefully and ensure that you have reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop.

options.name: presence_penalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

options.name: topP
options.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

options.name: reasoning_effort
options.description: Controls the amount of reasoning tokens to use. A value of "low" will favor speed and economical token usage, "high" will favor more complete reasoning at the cost of more tokens generated and slower responses.

options.name: Low
options.description: Favors speed and economical token usage

options.name: Medium
options.description: Balance between speed and reasoning accuracy

options.name: High
options.description: Favors more complete reasoning at the cost of more tokens generated and slower responses

options.name: maxToolsIterations
options.description: The maximum number of tool iteration cycles the LLM will run before stopping. A single iteration can contain multiple tool calls. Set to 0 for no limit.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model. Choose from the list, or specify an ID.

properties.displayName: When using non-OpenAI models via "Base URL" override, not all models might be chat-compatible or support other features, like tools calling or JSON response format
properties.name: notice
options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: baseURL
options.description: Override the default base URL for the API

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768).

options.name: Text
options.description: Regular text response

options.name: JSON
options.description: Enables JSON mode, which should guarantee the message the model generates is valid JSON

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

options.name: reasoningEffort
options.description: Controls the amount of reasoning tokens to use. A value of "low" will favor speed and economical token usage, "high" will favor more complete reasoning at the cost of more tokens generated and slower responses.

options.name: Low
options.description: Favors speed and economical token usage

options.name: Medium
options.description: Balance between speed and reasoning accuracy

options.name: High
options.description: Favors more complete reasoning at the cost of more tokens generated and slower responses

options.name: timeout
options.description: Maximum amount of time a request is allowed to take in milliseconds

options.name: maxRetries
options.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt

options.name: topP
options.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

name: n8n-nodes-base.openThesaurus
description: Get synonmns for German words using the OpenThesaurus API

options.name: Get Synonyms
options.description: Get synonyms for a German word in German

properties.name: text
properties.description: The word to get synonyms for

options.name: baseform
options.description: Specifies the basic form for the search term if it is not already a basic form

options.name: similar
options.description: This also returns up to five similarly written words for each answer. This is useful to be able to make a suggestion to the user in the event of a possible typing error.

options.name: startswith
options.description: Like substring = true, but only finds words that begin with the specified search term

options.name: substring
options.description: Whether up to ten words are returned for each answer that only contain the search term as a partial word

options.name: substringFromResults
options.description: Specifies from which entry the partial word hits are to be returned. Only works together with substring = true.

options.name: substringMaxResults
options.description: Specifies how many partial word hits should be returned in total. Only works together with substring = true.

options.name: subsynsets
options.description: Whether each synonym group has its (optional) sub-terms supplied

options.name: supersynsets
options.description: Whether each synonym group is supplied with its (optional) generic terms

options.description: Used to specify both the field you wish to sort the results on (incident_number/created_at/resolved_at/urgency), as well as the direction (asc/desc) of the results. options.name: timeZone

options.name: until
options.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. (the limit on date ranges is 6 months).

options.name: urgencies
options.description: Urgencies of the incidents to be returned. Defaults to all urgencies. Account must have the urgencies ability to do this

options.name: userIds
options.description: Returns only the incidents currently assigned to the passed user(s). This expects one or more user IDs (multiple IDs can be added separated by comma).

name: n8n-nodes-base.perplexity
description: Interact with the Perplexity API to generate AI responses with citations

options.name: Message a Model
options.description: Create one or more completions for a given text

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model which will generate the completion

properties.name: messages
properties.description: Any optional system messages must be sent first, followed by alternating user and assistant messages

values.name: content
values.description: The content of the message to be sent

values.name: role

options.name: Assistant
options.description: Tell the model to adopt a specific tone or personality. Must alternate with user messages.

options.name: System
options.description: Set the models behavior or context. Must come before user and assistant messages.

options.name: User
options.description: Send a message as a user and get a response from the model

values.description: Role in shaping the model's response, it tells the model how it should behave and interact with the user

properties.name: simplify
properties.description: Whether to return only essential fields (ID, citations, message)

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Values greater than 1.0 penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. The number of tokens requested plus the number of prompt tokens sent in messages must not exceed the context window token limit of model requested.

options.name: temperature
options.description: The amount of randomness in the response, valued between 0 inclusive and 2 exclusive. Higher values are more random, and lower values are more deterministic.

options.name: topK
options.description: The number of tokens to keep for highest Top K filtering, specified as an integer between 0 and 2048 inclusive. If set to 0, Top K filtering is disabled. We recommend either altering Top K or Top P, but not both.

options.name: topP
options.description: The nucleus sampling threshold, valued between 0 and 1 inclusive. For each subsequent token, the model considers the results of the tokens with Top P probability mass. We recommend either altering Top K or Top P, but not both.

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: A value between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

options.name: returnImages
options.description: Whether or not a request to an online model should return images. Requires Perplexity API usage Tier-2.

options.name: returnRelatedQuestions
options.description: Whether or not a request to an online model should return related questions. Requires Perplexity API usage Tier-2.

options.name: searchDomainFilter
options.description: Limit the citations used by the online model to URLs from the specified domains. For blacklisting, add a - to the beginning of the domain string (e.g., -domain1). Currently limited to 3 domains. Requires Perplexity API usage Tier-3.

options.name: searchRecency
options.description: Returns search results within the specified time interval

values.name: batchSize
values.description: Input will be split in batches to throttle requests. -1 for disabled. 0 will be treated as 1.

values.name: batchInterval
values.description: Time (in milliseconds) between each batch of requests. 0 for disabled.

options.name: allowUnauthorizedCerts
options.description: Whether to accept the response even if SSL certificate validation is not possible

options.name: proxy
options.description: HTTP proxy to use. If authentication is required it can be defined as follow: http://username:password@myproxy:3128

options.name: timeout
options.description: Time in ms to wait for the server to send response headers (and start the response body) before aborting the request

properties.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

properties.name: on
properties.description: On/Off state of the light

options.name: alert
None
options.description: The light is not performing an alert effect

options.name: Select
options.description: The light is performing one breathe cycle

options.name: LSelect
options.description: The light is performing breathe cycles for 15 seconds or until an "alert": "none" command is received
The alert effect, is a temporary change to the bulbs state

options.name: bri
options.description: The brightness value to set the light to. Brightness is a scale from 1 (the minimum the light is capable of) to 254 (the maximum).

options.name: bri_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the brightness. This value is ignored if the Brightness attribute is provided.

options.name: ct
options.description: The Mired color temperature of the light. 2012 connected lights are capable of 153 (6500K) to 500 (2000K).

options.name: ct_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the ct. ct_inc is ignored if the ct attribute is provided.

options.name: xy
options.description: The x and y coordinates of a color in CIE color space. The first entry is the x coordinate and the second entry is the y coordinate. Both x and y are between 0 and 1

options.name: xy_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the xy. This value is ignored if the Coordinates attribute is provided. Any ongoing color transition is stopped. Max value [0.5, 0.5]

options.name: effect
options.description: The dynamic effect of the light

options.name: hue
options.description: The hue value to set light to.The hue value is a wrapping value between 0 and 65535. Both 0 and 65535 are red, 25500 is green and 46920 is blue.

options.name: hue_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the hue. Hue Increments is ignored if the Hue attribute is provided.

options.name: sat
options.description: Saturation of the light. 254 is the most saturated (colored) and 0 is the least saturated (white).

options.name: sat_inc
options.description: Increments or decrements the value of the sat. This value is ignored if the Saturation attribute is provided.

options.name: transitiontime
options.description: The duration in seconds of the transition from the lights current state to the new state
